text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen today I am 
making tom yum fried rice or kao fad tom yum

now if you know what Tom Yum is you can probably 
agree with me that that idea just sounds really

really good and you don't know what them yum is it 
is our probably our most popular soup it's a spicy

and sour soup with lemongrass and lime leaves and 
it is mmm so good so thumb yum is awesome fried

rice is awesome and you put the two together and 
it's just awesome overload so let's get started

first I'm going to make the tom Yum paste it's 
concentrated tom yum flavor that we're going

to use as a fried rice sauce okay so we're going 
to start out with the three herbs that make them

yum yum yum which is the lemongrass so i finely 
chopped this because lemongrass is very stringy

so you want to make sure you slice it so you have 
no more long fibers and then we're gonna pound it

into a paste we have of course some galangal 
gallego is sort of a cousin of the ginger it's

a rhizome it's got a really fresh sort of pine 
forest tea aroma and all you have to do is cut

it into small slices and add it to the paste as 
well if you really can't find it you can leave

it out that's okay the last of the Trinity of 
thumb member is kaffir lime leaves we want to

really really chop it finely because it's very 
tough Lee think of it kind of like bay leaf so

that when you're eating it it doesn't feel 
like they're stringy bits in your mouth so

that's going in so I'm going to pound that 
into a paste first if you want to make this

spicy which you sort of should because the non 
spicy boom yum is a bit of an oxymoron but you

know add as much as your tolerance level will 
allow I'm gonna add two Thai chilies make it

something just jumped try not to look at it 
when you pound because it does tend to jump

in your face once you no longer have big chunks 
of anything that's good enough now the rest of

the seasoning goes in some sugar especially 
for something that's quite sour you want to

definitely cut it with some sugar and Thai chili 
paste no Thai chili paste or Thai chili jam is

very iconic in boom Yum Goong or Tom Yum with 
shrimp if you can't find it at the store I have

a recipe for how you can make this I make this one 
myself some fish sauce of course this is after all

thumb YUM and then to keep the spirit of fried 
rice I'm going to add some soy sauce and then of

course the tartness some lime juice lots of lime 
juice and that is it that is concentrated Tom Yum

paste now this mmm this looks like it could be 
good on a lot of things so hey just a few more

ingredients and then we're ready to cook so I've 
got some shrimp here peeled and deveined them

you can use chicken or whatever else you want 
some tomatoes because we're doing fried rice

I remove the seeds because the seeds have a lot 
of liquid and it could potentially give too much

liquid and make our fried rice soggy vegetables 
I am using guilin or Chinese broccoli I chose

Chinese broccoli because I like the crunchiness of 
the stem and I sort of happened to have it for my

patio video all right let's talk rice as you can 
see before the sauce is quite liquidy there's a

lot of liquid so it's particularly important that 
your rice is not too wet if you want to check out

my tips for making the best rice for fried rice 
you can check out my pineapple fried rice video

I'll put the link right up here you can click 
that little info button and check out all the

different tips that go into making fried rice 
dry and the grain separate beautifully so you

don't get mushy clumpy fried rice so my secret 
ingredient for thumb fried rice is actually a

fried egg that's gonna go on top of this rice so 
I've got a wok here with a lot of oil we're gonna

fry this egg sort of Thai style which is sort 
of semi deep frying an egg and what that does

it creates really nice bubbly crispy edges so 
get the oil quite hot and you want the you want

the egg to start bubbling like that right away 
okay because otherwise you won't get crispy edge

I'm gonna cook the shrimp first and if you know 
me you know I like to do that I'd like to cook

my protein separately then I never overcook it 
so let it sear on one side flip them over see if

your pan is hot enough your shrimp should get a 
little bit Brown and crispy so once that's done

take the shrimp out in the same wok I'm gonna add 
just a little bit of oil and by the way if you

for whatever reason burnt the shrimp or and the 
oil looks really dark you can start fresh with a

fresh wok and then I'm going to go in first with 
the onions so once the onion is translucent I'm

gonna go in with my vegetables just toss that and 
once the vegetables are well coated and they turn

sort of bright green go in with your rice give 
that just a quick toss see and my rice was nice

and cold and it was cooked and prepped well 
according to my tips I have no problem with

clumps so now the sauce is going to go in and I 
know this looks like a lot of sauce that's why

you got to make sure your rice is dry and now 
just keep tossing until it's well distributed

all the grains are coated so you want to cook it 
until the rice is dry as well if you see any big

clumps of rice just use the back of your spatula 
to press on it another key with fried rice is to

not cook too much in one pan because otherwise you 
really trap a lot of steam and things become wet

now crank the heat now so that I can get the rice 
to be dry that looks good okay I'm happy with that

I'm going to throw in the tomatoes and also the 
shrimp toss it one more time to get the tomatoes

warmed up get the shrimp warmed up marry mingle 
all those flavors together oh my god this was so

good and that's it and I'm going to toss in some 
green onions okay this is your first time making

this make sure you taste it okay and if you want 
to adjust the flavor with more seasoning now's

the time to do it and that's it let's plate it up 
so I'm going to finish this off with some chopped

cilantro now of course the egg right on top and 
that is it that is cow Pat boom YUM ortho me I'm

fried rice you want to make sure you break the 
yolk and let that yolk run into your rice this is

the perfect vice it has everything in it that is 
worthy of a yummy dance so good just that all the

flavors that you love in Thumb yam the lemongrass 
the lime leaf the tartness of the line the

sweetness of the chili paste everything's working 
so well and the yolk the creamy yolk just sort of

like binds everything together mellowing it out 
a little bit oh my god this is so good so if you

love some yum you are going to love this one so 
the recipe as always is on hot Thai Kitchen calm

when you make it send me a photo Facebook Twitter 
Instagram and I'll be sure to include a sample of

them in my newsletter if you haven't subscribed 
to the newsletter the link to do that is write

this info little button here and if you haven't 
subscribed to the YouTube channel the button is

right there buttons everywhere and I will see you 
next time for your next delicious Thai meal you
